Technique: ENGOBE; FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED
Name: Cylix
Description: Bitruncate cone-shaped cylix with wide mouth and inward turning rim. The body has a well-marked curvature in the middle and a stable base with a concave foot. The upper third of the body presents a painted decoration in white and black on the basis of semicircles and vertical stripes. On the rest of the body fine striations can be observed.
